Del_McCoury_Band:
{{short description|American bluegrass band}} {{refimprove|date=June 2013}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Del McCoury Band | image = HSB 2005 - Del McCoury Band.jpg | caption = [[Ronnie McCoury]], [[Jason Carter (fiddler)|Jason Carter]], [[Robbie McCoury]], [[Del McCoury]], and [[Alan Bartram]] performing at the [[Hardly Strictly Bluegrass Festival]], [[San Francisco]], [[California]] in 2005. | image_size = | landscape = yes | alias = Del McCoury and the Dixie Pals (1967–1988) | origin = | instrument = | genre = [[Bluegrass music|Bluegrass]]
[[Jam band]] | occupation = | years_active = [[1967 in music|1967]]–present | label = [[Sugar Hill Records (bluegrass)|Sugar Hill]] | associated_acts = [[Steve Earle]], [[Dierks Bentley]], [[The Travelin' McCourys]] | website = [http://www.delmccouryband.com/ www.delmccouryband.com] | current_members = [[Del McCoury]]
[[Ronnie McCoury]]
[[Robbie McCoury]]
[[Jason Carter (fiddler)|Jason Carter]]
[[Alan Bartram]] | past_members = }} The '''Del McCoury Band''' is a [[Grammy award]]-winning American [[bluegrass music|bluegrass]] band. ==History== Originally the band was called [[Del McCoury]] and the Dixie Pals with Del on guitar and his brother Jerry on bass. The band went through a number of changes in personnel until the 1980s when the band solidified its line-up, adding McCoury's sons, [[Ronnie McCoury|Ronnie]] and [[Robbie McCoury|Robbie]] on mandolin and banjo, respectively.Kingsbury, Paul, [https://books.google.com/books?id=untabCgOVkgC&dq=del+McCoury&pg=PA335 The Encyclopedia of Country Music]. Oxford University Press, 1998. p. 335 In 1988, the "Dixie Pals" name was dropped in favor of the current name. Fiddler Tad Marks and bass player Mike Brantley joined in the early 1990s while the band became a national touring act.{{cite news|last1=Yates|first1=Don|title=Album Review: Del McCoury Band - The Cold Hard Facts|url=http://nodepression.com/album-review/del-mccoury-band-cold-hard-facts|access-date=17 April 2017|work=No Depression|date=31 October 1996|archive-date=18 April 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170418163126/http://nodepression.com/album-review/del-mccoury-band-cold-hard-facts|url-status=dead}} The addition of fiddler [[Jason Carter (fiddler)|Jason Carter]] and bassist [[Mike Bub]] in 1992 created a lineup that was unchanged for 13 years. Bub left the band in 2005 and was replaced by Alan Bartram. ===Awards=== In 1999 the Del McCoury band was named "Entertainer of the Year" at the International Bluegrass Music Awards.''Bluegrass Awards Crown McCoury'', {{cite book|author=Nielsen Business Media, Inc.|title=Billboard|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=eAgEAAAAMBAJ&pg=PA30|date=30 October 1999|publisher=Nielsen Business Media, Inc.|pages=30–|issn=0006-2510}} In 2004 they were nominated for the [[Grammy Award]] for [[Grammy Award for Best Bluegrass Album|Best Bluegrass Album]] for ''It's Just the Night'',{{cite news|last1=Smykla |first1=Margaret |title=Local songwriter sees his work compete at Grammy Awards |url=http://www.post-gazette.com/neighborhoods-south/2004/02/11/Local-songwriter-sees-his-work-compete-at-Grammy-Awards/stories/pge.post-gazette.com |access-date=17 April 2017 |work=Pittsburgh Post-Gazette |date=11 February 2004}} and in 2006 they won that category for ''The Company We Keep''.{{cite magazine|last1=Endelman|first1=Michael|title=The unknown Grammy winners|url=http://ew.com/article/2006/02/17/unknown-grammy-winners/|access-date=17 April 2017|magazine=Entertainment Weekly|date=17 February 2006}} ===Collaborations=== The band recorded with [[Steve Earle]] on "I Still Carry You Around" on his 1997 album [[El Corazón (Steve Earle album)|El Corazón]].{{cite news|last1=Alden|first1=Grant|title=Album Review: Steve Earle - El Corazon|url=http://nodepression.com/album-review/steve-earle-el-corazon|access-date=17 April 2017|work=No Depression|date=31 October 1997}} They shared co-billing on his 1999 album [[The Mountain (Steve Earle album)|The Mountain]].{{cite news|last1=Nelson|first1=Chris|title=Steve Earle Climbs Bluegrass Mountain on New LP|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/512918/steve-earle-climbs-bluegrass-mountain-on-new-lp/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170418163002/http://www.mtv.com/news/512918/steve-earle-climbs-bluegrass-mountain-on-new-lp/|url-status=dead|archive-date=April 18, 2017|access-date=17 April 2017|work=MTV News|date=17 March 1999}} The band has also often performed in recent years with [[the Lee Boys]], with setlists mixing bluegrass, funk and gospel with extended jams on many songs.{{cite news|last1=Starrs|first1=Chris|title=Travelin' McCourys, Lee Boys taking it to the road|url=http://onlineathens.com/stories/011809/mar_378366195.shtml#.WPWEuXNlDqA |access-date=17 April 2017|work=Athens Banner-Herald|date=18 January 2009}} ===Travelin' McCourys=== [[The Travelin' McCourys]] are an offshoot of the Del McCoury Band, featuring all current (2009) members of the band minus Del, augmented by guitarist Cody Kilby on live performances.{{cite news|last1=Lawless|first1=John|title=Cody Kilby leaves Skaggs for The Travelin' McCourys|url=https://bluegrasstoday.com/cody-kilby-leaves-skaggs-for-the-travelin-mccourys/|access-date=17 April 2017|work=Bluegrass Today|date=10 November 2015}} The Travelin' McCourys also often play joint concerts with the Lee Boys. ==Band members== [[Image:Mccoury-band.jpg|thumb|250px|right|Del McCoury band at MerleFest in 2007.]] ;Current members *[[Del McCoury]] - vocals, guitar (1967–present) *[[Ronnie McCoury]] - [[mandolin]] (1981–present) *[[Rob McCoury]] - [[banjo]] (1987–present) *[[Jason Carter (fiddler)|Jason Carter]] - [[fiddle]] (1992–present) *[[Alan Bartram]] - [[double bass|bass]] (August 2005–present) ;Former members *Jerry McCoury - bass (1967–1989) *Billy Baker - fiddle (1967) *Mike Brantley - bass (1989–1992) *[[Tad Marks]] - fiddle (1990–1992) *Mike Bub - Director |- | 2003 ! scope="row"| "My Love Will Not Change" | |- | 2003 ! scope="row"| "She Can't Burn Me Now" | |} ===Contributions=== * 2007: Ronnie McCoury - ''Little Mo' McCoury'' (McCoury Music) * 2007: Various Artists: ''[[Song of America (album)|Song of America]]'' - "[[The Times They Are a-Changin' (song)|The Times They Are a-Changin']]" ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.ibiblio.org/hillwilliam/BGdiscography/?svalue=Del+McCoury+Band&stype=band&v=sresults&search=Search Discography] at Discography of Bluegrass Sound Recordings *[http://www.delmccouryband.com/ Official website] *[https://archive.org/details/DelMcCouryBand Del McCoury Band collection] at the [[Internet Archive]]'s live music archive * {{Allmusic | id= the-del-mccoury-band-mn0000146354 | label= Del McCoury Band}} * {{discogs artist|290039-The-Del-McCoury-Band|Del McCoury Band}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Del McCoury Band}} [[Category:American bluegrass music groups]] [[Category:Jam bands]] [[Category:Grammy Award winners]]
